selected_quotes: Software Carpentry: lessons learned. What works, what doesn't, and how can we better educate scientists in computing.
Allowing scientists to be part of the changes that are transforming science
This week's featured article is Software Carpentry: lessons learned, by Greg Wilson of Mozilla Science Lab.
For all scientists sitting in from of computer: Software Carpentry Wilson G, published

citation.abstract: Over the last 15 years, Software Carpentry has evolved from a week-long training course at the US National Laboratories into a worldwide volunteer effort to raise standards in scientific computing. This article explains what we have learned along the way, the challenges we now face, and our plans for the future.
citation.title: Software Carpentry: lessons learned
